channel.title: Accounts get erased
channel.description:
For some reason on my server when a player tries to login and accidently doesnt put a username or password, it erases all the information in their character account.
Why does it do this?

item.title: Accounts get erased
item.dc:creator: @droidmobile droidmobile@yahoo.com
item.description:
@droidmobile wrote:

hwo could i add it to where it automatically puts the last usename and password that had entered when they re-open the client?

This would help alot

Read full topic

item.title: Accounts get erased
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“droidmobile@yahoo.com, post:3, topic:376202”]What does this have to do with their accounts that are already made being erased?

They have an account already but once they close the client and re-open it to login, if they forget to put their username and password in and click login, it erases everything in their character file that was already saved from last login.
Like it glitches their character to reset…[/quote]it could have EVERYTHING to do with it being the fact that it actually DOES IT.

Read full topic

item.title: Accounts get erased
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You should just add a condition to check usernames before the login process completes.

Read full topic

item.title: Accounts get erased
item.dc:creator: @droidmobile droidmobile@yahoo.com
item.description:
@droidmobile wrote:

What does this have to do with their accounts that are already made being erased?

They have an account already but once they close the client and re-open it to login, if they forget to put their username and password in and click login, it erases everything in their character file that was already saved from last login.
Like it glitches their character to reset…

Read full topic

item.title: Accounts get erased
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

All servers require a username and password to be saved for the character file to be created .

Read full topic
